posts.name: Brian Scharles Jr
posts.cooked:
Looking for any recommendations on lightweight solenoids and manifolds, similar in style to the SMC that Vex sells but smaller / lighter.

In an older CD thread someone recommended these from AutomationDirect, which would work except these manifolds only have a single output for each solenoid, and we need both (we only plan to use Single acting solenoids, but need both sides to extend and retract the cylinders)

posts.name: Skye Leake
posts.cooked: Could you use two of these to mimic a double action? I don’t know if that nulls out the weight savings…

posts.name: Mark McLeod
posts.cooked:
.1 lbs: CKD Single Solenoid Valve with Fixed Wires - AndyMark, Inc .14 lbs: CKD Double Solenoid Valve with Fixed Wires - AndyMark, Inc

No separate manifold weight but does need the M5 push-in fittings: 3 Valve Manifold Fitting Pack - AndyMark, Inc .

They come in a manifold version, too, if you really want that. A 4 slot is about .35 lbs.

link_counts.title: CKD Single Solenoid Valve with Fixed Wires - AndyMark, Inc
CKD Double Solenoid Valve with Fixed Wires - AndyMark, Inc
3 Valve Manifold Fitting Pack - AndyMark, Inc

posts.name: Troy Dietz
posts.cooked: Depending on what you’re doing, excluding the manifold is often quite a bit lighter.

posts.name: Josh (he/him)
posts.cooked:
I would definitely consider an inline type valve if you’re trying to cut weight of the manifold blocks without sacrificing flow rate. This can also be helpful in terms of actuation speed/air consumption too, since you can potentially place your valves closer to your actuator.

On a strict mass basis, Festo’s single and double acting 5/2 valves are the lightest I have seen, at least compared to the CKD and SMC offerings seen at AM and Vex. They also have a bit higher flow rating (360 l/min, or ~.33 Cv) thanks to the M7 ports.

Disclaimer: I do work for Festo
